content: [onef] After everything that happened at Einartoft?
[onef] And they might voluntarily put a sword in your gut, too.
[onef] A shrewd man with ambitions can be very patient.
[onef] But it's always been about trust.
[onef] Doesn't mean they won't.
[onef] Don't fool yourself, Rook, it's mostly you.
[onef] Gotta disagree with that, Rook. We always have a choice.
[onef] He's fearless, I'll give you that. But look at him, he's run ragged. He can't be there all the time.
[onef] How does that make any damn sense?
[onef] How many strangers are in the caravan now?
[onef] How well do you know the people traveling with us?
[onef] If Krumr gave the word I guarantee at least half would follow.
[onef] I heard they were found practically dead in the middle of nowhere when the dredge started showing up.
[onef] I mean, it seems pretty clear that they'd die to protect you.
[onef] I'm grateful for what you've done to get us this far, Rook.
[onef] I suggest growing some balls instead of hoping it all works out, Rook.
[onef] I think it's time to part ways, so to speak. Nothing personal.
[onef] I've been watching folks since I joined you. Your companions from Skogr, they're loyal.
[onef] Let's be honest, they could take this caravan by force at any time, if they wanted to.
[onef] Let's be honest, they could take this caravan by force at any time, if they wanted to.

content.option: I've got no choice but to trust them

content: [onef] Myself, I think we lucked out when his mentor didn't show up in Sigrholm. Eyvind's just the /=apprentice=/? What in the depths is his master capable of?
[onef] Or Eyvind might be.
[onef] Or we could make it clear who is in charge here.
[onef] Points you should have made on your own.
[onef rook] After everything that happened at Einartoft?

content.option: I trust Iver to handle it
If they're willing to fight it's worth the risk

content: [onef rook] How does that make any damn sense?

content.option: You might be distorting what happened
Eyvind could have taken control long before now

content: [onef rook] How many strangers are in the caravan now?

content.option: The group decides, not just me
We have picked up quite a few...

content: [onef] Suddenly they need our help instead of the mender council's?
[onef] That's an obvious example.
[onef] That's why we're having this chat, Rook.
[onef] Then an enormous serpent shows up at Einartoft after tearing the world in half, takes one look at Eyvind and bolts.
[onef] There's a mender with us. A mender who pulls lightning out of the sky and tells us what to do and where to go.
[onef] They're not the biggest problem, though.
[onef] Think about it, Rook. What do you really know about Eyvind?
[onef] Until the moment that it's all gone wrong.
[onef] What about the varl? You don't even know half those warriors.
[onef] What happens the first time the varl don't want to do what you tell them?
[onef] You're telling me they have no problem following a man's orders now?
[rook] I suppose I'd do the same.
[rook] What's on your mind?
{skip} mark1=rook mark2=onef
/=Suddenly you gasp for air. When you look down, Onef is holding a knife buried deep in your ribs.=/
